title: Recently off ban, help?
body: So I just got off a reasonable 14 day ban, and I'm scared to play games because I'm on probation ATM so basically I have to be good for a few months or so. I want to know what I can and cannot do while on this probation (or maybe just in general without probation)

replies.body:
I'm glad you're not making a rage post about your ban instead you're worried you'll make the same mistake. 

Like everyone else suggested, mute all works. BUT the thing is even if you mute all you're still at risk of raging in chat of a bad player etc (trust me i've done this to bad plays etc).

You should read this post :)
https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/76xaqz/protip_be_tiltproof/?utm_term=29d2f3e2-13cc-4d15-9caf-1af83abb9cc6&utm_medium=search&utm_source=reddit&utm_name=leagueoflegends&utm_content=1

Goes through simple things you can say just to lift team morale and avoid toxicity and another ban :)

Hope you find it useful!

muteall for 5 games then you'll be free from the 1 game till perma that way you dont respond to any1 make sure they're norms too so you're not under pressure

remember reform takes time

Probably the simplest way to put it would be, as is stated in the boards rules, "don't be a jerk". No one likes it when someone else is a jerk to them, it helps to keep in mind all the times you've been on the receiving end of such behaviour, as that will give you an idea of what you're doing to others by acting that way. I'd recommend taking a look at the [Summoner's Code](http://oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/featured/summoners-code). It's a quick read, in it's current state, but has some good (though generic) points, things like "work as a team", "don't give up" and "be helpful".

Some advice that may help: don't respond to negative players. Use the mute function if you need to. Many of the players who act inappropriately are just looking for attention, or are trying to prove a point. By responding to them, you're giving them exactly what they're looking for. If you feel like you might lash out, mute them, you'll still be able to communicate using pings, where necessary. Once the game is finished, you can report them in the post-match lobby.

If you need to, it could be a good idea to give LoL a break while you reflect on the behaviour that got you punished. Go find a different game, maybe a single player one, where you can get a similar amount of enjoyment, and work on those aspects of your behaviour that are most problematic. There are also a variety of other "outlets" you can use for that kind of thing, such as reading a good book, taking part in physical exercise (particularly things like martial arts) or using a form of creative outlet (painting, drawing, writing, sculpting etc.)
